thread.title: Fixed Income Analyst at Princeton Information (New York, NY)
thread.title_full: Fixed Income Analyst at Princeton Information (New York, NY)

title: Fixed Income Analyst at Princeton Information (New York, NY)
text: Source: Dice Intake Call 41615 Trade Validation and Control Operations Derivatives experience preferred Experience with ISDA confirmations requested, key. Targeted areas On-Boarding, Markitwire, DTCC, Paper Confirmations OTC Derivatives experience requested Project or Confirmations experience Fixed Income (rate, credit) or Equity experience required Excel (v-lookups, pivot tables) Basic Powerpoint Additional information to the job Overall goal The candidate will be within the Fixed Income Operations Documentation area and will be responsible for account setup accuracy and testing. This role requires an individual with industry experience in Derivatives. Main responsibilities and key tasks Perform due diligence in respect of static requirements for Onboarding ensure that details of ISDA Master Agreements and valid Client relationships are consistent in Legal and Client Onboarding systems Liaise with Front Office, Legal and Credit departments to resolve inconsistentincomplete details request OTC relationship extensions, Framesoft and Client ID update accordingly Perform UAT for DTCCPaper process Assist with break resolution Work alongside with Change and IT Soft skills Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint knowledge required. Ability to organize and prioritize Strong organizational skills with ability to prioritize work Excellent communication and presentation skills (both written and verbal) Pro-active and highly motivated desire to question beyond the basics, goal orientated and drives for resolution of problems High levels of accuracy and attention to details Ability to adapt to change Training experience 18 months experience within a paper or electronic Fixed Income product processing role. Ability to work efficiently and accurately within a high pressured environment. Solid team player with exceptional analytical and interpersonal skills. Demonstrates pro activity, is able to problem solve and adapt to change. Strong attention to detail with a desire to question and improve processes. Understand overall business requirements and Operations strategy Understand and support system implementations Report in a timely manner, any issues which have possible risk effects on the business. Ability to multi-task, work to deadlines and accommodate varying levels of volume and priorities Education Basic education Undergraduate degree or equivalent diploma Thank you for your interest... For immediate consideration please contact Syed Uddin at syed.uddinprincetoninformation.com or 201-205-2295. Princeton Information is one of the nation's top five privately-held IT consulting firms, in business since 1985. Princeton Information services a clientele of primarily Fortune 500 companies nationwide. With annual revenues over 120 million, Princeton Information operates across the US from multiple regional offices. Our Commitment to Our Consultants As a privately held company, Princeton Information is solely committed to the success of clients and consultants - not to any shareholders. PI's success is grounded in the relationships we build with our consultants. We seek the best people provide career path counseling as well as the most challenging opportunities in business and in IT. As part of its culture of loyalty and commitment to its consultants, Princeton Information is committed to doing all we can to ensure our consultants have the best possible search, placement and work experience possible. Our Services Working with one Princeton Recruiter will gain you access to over 500 open requirements with the top clients in the US across all industries (finance, insurance, pharmaceutical, commercial, telecom, media, manufacturing) nationwide. Our local recruiters have in-depth knowledge of our clients and opportunities. They will work with you to find you the best possible opportunities for you and your career. Our Relationships Our relationships with our clients, as well as our consultants, are critical to our success! We have a robust sales organization that ensures that Princeton has the inside track on what attributes a person needs in order to be successfully placed and engaged at our clients. We know the technical and non-technical skills that our clients are looking for and we ensure that you are educated about the client prior to your interview with them. Princeton is committed to going above and beyond to ensure that each meeting you have with a client is a successful one! (TRADE VALIDATION over 1 year(s) ) AND (FIXED INCOME over 1 year(s) ) AND (VALIDATION OR CONTROL ) AND(ANALYST ) AND (EXCEL ) AND (TRADE OR EQUITY ) AND(DERIVATIVE )
